news_header: Finnish households saw minimal returns on their investments in local shares, while foreign investments performed better. The overall value of household investments increased slightly, but the Helsinki Stock Exchange's weak performance impacted returns.
news_original_title: Sijoititko suomalaisiin pörssiyhtiöihin? Osakkeiden tuotto oli viime vuonna pyöreät nolla
news_text: Finnish households held EUR 46.5 billion in listed shares at the end of last year, but the value increased only slightly due to a zero return on domestic shares, primarily because of the weak performance of the Helsinki Stock Exchange. While households received nearly EUR 2 billion in dividends, the value of shares fell by a similar amount. In contrast, foreign equity investments yielded an 18% return, despite making up only 15% of the equity portfolio. Households invested EUR 1.6 billion more in Finnish investment funds, with a significant increase in fund holdings overall. The average interest rate on deposits declined throughout the year.
